com.sri.ai.util.cache

Class FlexibleCacheMap<K,V,K_,V_>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.util.cache.FlexibleCacheMap<K,V,K_,V_>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheMap<K,V>, java.util.Map<K,V>

    @Beta
public class FlexibleCacheMap<K,V,K_,V_>
extends java.lang.Object
implements CacheMap<K,V>
    A CacheMap that offers more flexibility than DefaultCacheMap with respect to what exactly it stores and returns. It works as a CacheMap between keys of type K and values of type V. However, it actually stores internal keys of type K_ and values of type V_.

    Such functions are by the user to provide abstractions in the sets of values stored and recovered.

    The relationship between keys and values and their stored counterparts is given by user-defined functions. See constructors parameters names to see what these functions should take as input and output.

    Author:
    braz

      • getGarbageCollectionPeriod

        public int getGarbageCollectionPeriod()
        Description copied from interface: CacheMap
        Returns the current number of calls to the cache made between one automatic garbage collection to the other. The automatic garbage collection is done by using the reachable objects iterator provided by CacheMap.getReachableObjectIteratorMaker() function. A value of -1 indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Specified by:
        getGarbageCollectionPeriod in interface CacheMap<K,V>
        Returns:
        the garbage collection period associated with the cache map.

      • getReachableObjectIteratorMaker

        public NullaryFunction<java.util.Iterator<K>> getReachableObjectIteratorMaker()
        Description copied from interface: CacheMap
        Returns the current reachable objects iterator maker. A null value indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Specified by:
        getReachableObjectIteratorMaker in interface CacheMap<K,V>
        Returns:
        the factory method for creating a reachable objects iterator.

      • setGarbageCollectionPeriod

        public void setGarbageCollectionPeriod(int period)
        Description copied from interface: CacheMap
        Allows the user to set the number of cache calls between automatic garbage collections. A value of -1 indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Specified by:
        setGarbageCollectionPeriod in interface CacheMap<K,V>
        Parameters:
        period - set the number of cache calls between number of automatic garbage collections, a value of -1 indicates that no automatic garbage collection.

      • setReachableObjectIteratorMaker

        public void setReachableObjectIteratorMaker(NullaryFunction<java.util.Iterator<K>> reachableObjectIteratorMaker)
        Description copied from interface: CacheMap
        Allows the user to provide a new reachable objects iterator maker. A null value indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Specified by:
        setReachableObjectIteratorMaker in interface CacheMap<K,V>
        Parameters:
        reachableObjectIteratorMaker - a factory method for creating a reachable object iterator. If null, not automatic garbage collection will take place.
